title: Software Engineer · Full-time
highlights: Led multiple 3–6 month long digital transformation initiatives across pharma, biofuels, and utilities sectors, managing end-to-end execution from discovery to deployment and client onboarding.
Defined product vision and digital roadmaps in collaboration with engineering, IT, and finance, delivering customized MES solutions aligned to client goals.
Facilitated Agile cadences and stakeholder syncs to resolve blockers and ensure timely, high-quality delivery across all client projects.
Built custom integrations across MES, virtual machines, and client environments using Python and PowerShell; reduced manual configuration time by 60% and improved deployment scalability.
Building internal SME-level expertise in a new partner platform by aligning its capabilities with common industry use cases and developing a demo system for sales enablement.
Leading the development of a standardized deployment methodology to guide future client implementations and position the platform for scalable success.
Presented at the Big Ten & Friends Utility Conference with Notre Dame leadership, highlighting MES deployment outcomes and impact on utility operations.

title: Enterprise XR Technical Product Management Intern · Internship
location: Santa Clara, California, United States · Remote
highlights: Developed VR & AR prototype applications using Unity to demonstrate CloudXR's capabilities, presenting to 5 prospective customers and gathering insights that informed product strategy and feature prioritization, while showcasing the project to multiple internal teams for feedback and feature testing.

Managed the integration of Nvidia's CloudXR with a Swiss-based VR company's medical and surgery training app, aligning stakeholders and overcoming technical challenges to enable a university to adopt the technology for medical education without the need for heavy hardware investments.

Authored detailed user stories and designed an impactful product demo to communicate the value of new XR technologies to partners, directly contributing to the product roadmap and resulting in a featured blog post that increased visibility for Nvidia's CloudXR solutions among potential clients.

title: Frontend Developer · Self-employed
highlights: Led the development of a full-stack mobile application that streamlined recipe websites by removing unnecessary content, resulting in 70% of users returning to the app for repeated use.

Authored a comprehensive design document outlining user requirements, feature prioritization, development roadmap, architecture diagrams, and testing strategies, guiding the team in building a user-centric mobile application.

title: IT Enterprise Apps Project Management Intern · Internship
highlights: Integrated a new project management tool to identify workflow bottlenecks, reducing the need for cross-functional team meetings by 50% and improving overall project efficiency.
Redesigned the IT project management framework by implementing Agile methodologies, streamlining processes and reducing project delivery times by 30% across Finance, Marketing, and Legal departments.

Collaborated with a Senior Project Manager to define project requirements and develop a product roadmap for enterprise app solutions, aligning with business objectives and managing the end-to-end product lifecycle from conception to launch.
